greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows, A054533 * transpose(A101688) (matrix product) provided A101688 is read as a square array by antidiagonals upwards.
link: Jinyuan Wang, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: Triangle read by rows, A054533 * transpose(A101688) (matrix product); i.e., partial sums from of the right of triangle A054533 (because A101688 can be viewed as an upper triangular matrix of 1's).
T(n,k) = Sum_{m = k..n} A054533(n,m) = Sum_{d|n} d * mu(n/d) * ((n/d) - ceiling(k/d) + 1) for n >= 1 and 1 <= k <= n.
T(n,k) = phi(n) - Sum_{d|n} d * mu(n/d) * ceiling(k/d) for n >= 2 and 1 <= k <= n.
example: First few rows of the triangle are as follows:
row 4 = (0, 0, 2, 2) = partial sums from the right of row 4 of triangle A054533: (0, -2, 0, 2).
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_, Sep 20 2008
ext: Name edited by and more terms from _Petros Hadjicostas_, Jul 28 2019
